definition: to lean over/to fall (go down)/to hide (in ambush)/to conceal oneself/to lie low/hottest days of summer/to submit/to concede defeat/to overcome/to subdue/volt

sentences.english: And Israel set liers in wait round about Gibeah.
sentences.chinese: 以色列人在基比亚的四围设下伏兵。

sentences.english: Its shadows are an ambush, its lights a surprise .
sentences.chinese: 它的阴影象伏兵千万，它的光泽令人惊异。

sentences.english: A group of tigers is called a "streak" or an "ambush".
sentences.chinese: 有一组老虎被称为“条纹”或“伏兵”。

sentences.english: And Israel set tiers in wait round about Gibeah.
sentences.chinese: 以色列人在基比亚的四围设下伏兵。

sentences.english: Then Israel set an ambush around Gibeah.
sentences.chinese: 以色列人在基比亚的四围设下伏兵。

sentences.english: Set an ambush for the city behind it.
Set an ambush behind the city.
They had the soldiers take up their positions--all those in the camp to the north of the city and the ambush to the west of it.
sentences.chinese: 于是安置了百姓，就是城北的全军和城西的伏兵。

sentences.english: The enemy chased the decoys down to the place of ambush .
sentences.chinese: 敌人将诱骗者一直追到伏兵所在地。

sentences.english: When the Japanese advanced, they were fired at by snipers from all sides.
sentences.chinese: 日本人一来，到处都遭到伏兵的狙击。

definition: troops deployed to mislead the enemy
to seize a camp/to surprise the enemy in bed
to ambush/to lie in wait for/to lie low/ambush
to make a surprise attack/to pounce on (an enemy)
